example.eg: The policeman had his finger on the trigger of the gun.
example.egtrans: 警察把手放在枪的扳机上。

example.eg: Certain topics are triggers for me and I like to avoid them.
example.egtrans: 有的话题会触发我心理问题发作，我会尽量避开。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 触发因素, 触发点, 激发点

example.eg: Rachel burned the toast, triggering the smoke alarm.
example.egtrans: 瑞秋把面包烤糊了，触发了烟雾报警器。

example.eg: The assassination of the archduke triggered the war.
example.egtrans: 大公爵遇刺触发了战争。

example.eg: Please don't talk about that. It triggers me.
The terrorists used a mobile phone as the trigger for the bomb.
example.egtrans: 恐怖份子使用一部手机作为炸弹的引爆器。

example.eg: The trigger for the war was the assassination of the archduke.
example.egtrans: 大战的导火索是大公遭到暗杀。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 触发因素, 触发事件, 导火索

example.eg: Careful with that gun; it has a hair trigger and will go off at the slightest touch.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 容易触发的, 敏感的

example.eg: My new manager is making my life a living hell with his hair trigger temper.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一触即发的，反应敏捷的

dsense.name: quick on the draw, quick on the trigger, quick off the mark
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (quick to act or react)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抢先行动, 占取先机

dsense.name: trigger finger
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (index finger) (比喻，非正式用语)

example.eg: Whenever I hear someone bad-mouthing American English, my trigger finger starts to itch!

dsense.name: trigger finger
dsense.guideword: (finger that pulls trigger of a gun)

example.eg: At the beginning of the story about physical abuse, the radio presenter gave a trigger warning.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 动作快的, 行动迅速的
